description.narrative: The project is part of promoting cultural expressions that promote diversity , intercultural dialogue and cultural and human rightsin the context of reconciliation, conflict resolution and democratization and contributes to increase the role and place of women and young people, as citizens , in a supportive and respectful democratic, open , human rights and cultural diversity. Through activities relating to: the awareness and capacity of cultural actors , the media and civil society on the need to promote human rights , intercultural dialogue and attitudes / practices through antidiscrimination cultural expressions; cooperation between cultural operators , media, professionals in education and civil society in the field of production and dissemination of diversified cultural content, tailored to the national context and ensuring the promotion of human rights and the fight against all forms of discrimination based on ethnicity, gender, religious, etc. . As part of this action , Oxfam Novib and its partners, Alternative Spaces Citizens (AEC) and African Youth Foundation ( AFJ ) intend to use the edutainment (Education - Entertainment) as a means of creating a dynamic change to a democratic society that respects human rights and cultural diversity, with special emphasis on the role and place of womenand young people as citizens. This action is based on the experience accumulated over ten years by Oxfam Novib, the quiadéveloppé of Edutainment programs in different countries , in collaboration with culturalactors, civil society and the media . The Edutainment is a communication strategy that aims to bring about changes in attitudes, behaviors and beliefs about complex subjects such as values and gender-specific norms, social roles, and also the participation of youth and women, in civic life . The Edutainment uses andvalues formesd various cultural expression , from radio and television series and serials , musical videos and computer games , not to mention comics and street theater . This strategy combines cultural and mobilisationsociale expressions.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novibs main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fund raising, campaigning and advocacy. The Hub Niamey Niger exists since 2006 as a humanitarian field office and since 2012 as the decentralized Country office for Oxfam Novib, dealing with all the development and humanitarian themes like Sustainable livelihoods, Right to Basic services, Humanitarian and resilience interventions, The right to be heard and the right to an Identity, including women's rights and sexual and reproductive health rights. The Country Office in Niger works with local partners to realize the vision of a Niger without poverty
